maml:description.maml:para: Gets the current installed version and the latest version of Posh-SSH.
Gets the current installed version and the latest version of Posh-SSH.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para: C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code:
Get-PoshSSHModVersion
InstalledVersion CurrentVersion ---------------- -------------- 1.7 1.6

maml:description.maml:para: Get the current location of a SFTP Session
Get the current location of a SFTP Session specified by SessionId or SFTP Session Object.
The SessionId number of an existing SFTP Session.
Exiting SFTP Session object.
The SessionId number of an existing SFTP Session.
Exiting SFTP Session object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para:
Get current folder location of a SFTP Session
C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code: Get-SFTPCurrentDirectory -SessionId 0 /root

maml:description.maml:para: Get a List of Files for SFTP Session.

Remote path to list.
Exiting SFTP Session object.
Remote path to list.
The SessionId number of an existing SFTP Session.
Remote path to list.
Exiting SFTP Session object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para:
List files in the /tmp path on a remote SFTP Session
C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code:
Get-SFTPDirectoryList -SessionId 0 -Path "/tmp"
FullName : /tmp/vmware-root LastAccessTime : 4/13/2013 5:44:56 PM LastWriteTime : 4/13/2013 5:44:56 PM Length : 4096 UserId : 0
FullName : /tmp/.. LastAccessTime : 4/13/2013 5:31:46 PM LastWriteTime : 4/13/2013 7:11:05 PM Length : 4096 UserId : 0
FullName : /tmp/vmware-config1 LastAccessTime : 4/13/2013 5:44:23 PM LastWriteTime : 4/13/2013 5:44:23 PM Length : 4096 UserId : 0
FullName : /tmp/. LastAccessTime : 4/13/2013 8:11:43 PM LastWriteTime : 4/13/2013 8:11:41 PM Length : 4096 UserId : 0
FullName : /tmp/yum.conf.security LastAccessTime : 4/13/2013 6:19:22 PM LastWriteTime : 4/13/2013 6:19:21 PM Length : 865 UserId : 0
FullName : /tmp/.ICE-unix LastAccessTime : 4/13/2013 5:27:15 PM LastWriteTime : 4/13/2013 5:27:15 PM Length : 4096 UserId : 0

Path to get information on.

Path to get information on.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para:
Get information on a specified path on a remote host.
C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code:
Get-SFTPPathAttribute -SessionId 0 -Path "/tmp"
LastAccessTime : 2/27/2015 6:38:43 PM LastWriteTime : 2/27/2015 7:01:01 PM Size : 512 UserId : 0 GroupId : 0 IsSocket : False IsSymbolicLink : False IsRegularFile : False IsBlockDevice : False IsDirectory : True IsCharacterDevice : False IsNamedPipe : False OwnerCanRead : True OwnerCanWrite : True OwnerCanExecute : True GroupCanRead : True GroupCanWrite : True GroupCanExecute : True OthersCanRead : True OthersCanWrite : True OthersCanExecute : True Extensions :

maml:description.maml:para: Get current SFTP Sessions that are available for interaction.
Get current SFTP Sessions that are available for interaction.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para:
Get all current SFTP sessions.
C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code:
Get-SFTPSession
SessionId Host Connected --------- ---- --------- 0 192.168.1.180 True

command:example.dev:code:
Get-SSHSession

List Host and Fingerprint pairs that Posh-SSH trusts.

maml:description.maml:para: Executes a given command on a remote SSH host.
Executes a given command on a remote SSH hosst given credentials to the host or using an existing SSH Session.
SSH Session Id of an exiting session.
Command to execute in remote host.
Ensures a connection is made by reconnecting before command.
Command to execute in remote host.
Ensures a connection is made by reconnecting before command.
Command to execute in remote host.
SSH Session Id of an exiting session.
Ensures a connection is made by reconnecting before command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para:
Executes the "uname -a" command against several sessions
C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code:
Invoke-SSHCommand -Command "uname -a" -SessionId 0,2,3
Host : 192.168.1.163 Output : Linux debian6 2.6.32-5-amd64 #1 SMP Sun Sep 23 10:07:46 UTC 2012 x86_64 GNU/Linux
ExitStatus : 0
Host : 192.168.1.155 Output : Linux ole6 2.6.39-300.17.1.el6uek.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Oct 19 11:29:17 PDT 2012 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
ExitStatus : 0
Host : 192.168.1.234 Output : Linux ubuntusrv 3.2.0-29-generic #46-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jul 27 17:03:23 UTC 2012 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
ExitStatus : 0

maml:description.maml:para: Executes an action on a SSH ShellStream when output matches a desired string.
Executes an action on a SSH ShellStream when output matches a desired string.
SSH Shell Stream.
Initial command that will generate the output to be evaluated by the expect pattern.
String on what to trigger the action on.
Command to execute once an expression is matched.
Number of seconds to wait for a match.
SSH Shell Stream.
Initial command that will generate the output to be evaluated by the expect pattern.
Regular expression on what to trigger the action on.
Command to execute once an expression is matched.
Number of seconds to wait for a match.
SSH Shell Stream.
Initial command that will generate the output to be evaluated by the expect pattern.
String on what to trigger the action on.
Command to execute once an expression is matched.
Number of seconds to wait for a match.
Regular expression on what to trigger the action on.
Executes an action stored in a SecureString on a SSH ShellStream when output matches a desired string.

Executes an action stored in a secure string when an output is matched. By the expect action being in a secure string this function is best used when a password must be provided to a promp protecting it in memory. Examples uses would be for use in su or sudo commands.
SSH Shell Stream.
Initial command that will generate the output to be evaluated by the expect pattern.
String on what to trigger the action on.
SecureString representation of action once an expression is matched.
Number of seconds to wait for a match.
SSH Shell Stream.
Initial command that will generate the output to be evaluated by the expect pattern.
Regular expression on what to trigger the action on.
SecureString representation of action once an expression is matched.
Number of seconds to wait for a match.
SSH Shell Stream.
Initial command that will generate the output to be evaluated by the expect pattern.
String on what to trigger the action on.
SecureString representation of action once an expression is matched.
Number of seconds to wait for a match.
Regular expression on what to trigger the action on.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para:
Execute su command and pass protected password in a secure string to the SSH shell stream.
C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code:
Invoke-SSHStreamExpectSecureAction -ShellStream $stream -Command 'su -' -ExpectString 'Passord:' -SecureAction (read-host -AsSecureString) -Verbose
*********** VERBOSE: Executing command su -. VERBOSE: Waiting for match. VERBOSE: Executing action. VERBOSE: Action has been executed. True PS C:\> $stream.Read()
Last login: Sat Mar 14 18:18:52 EDT 2015 on pts/0 Last failed login: Sun Mar 15 08:52:07 EDT 2015 on pts/0 There were 2 failed login attempts since the last successful login. [root@localhost ~]#

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para:
Invoke ifconfig command using sudo and provide the password for the account that is saved in a SecureString.
C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code:
$sudoPassPropmp = [regex]':\s$' PS C:\> Invoke-SSHStreamExpectSecureAction -ShellStream $stream -Command 'sudo ifconfig' -ExpectRege x $sudoPassPropmp -SecureAction (read-host -AsSecureString) -Verbose *********** VERBOSE: Executing command sudo ifconfig. VERBOSE: Waiting for match. VERBOSE: Matching by RegEx. VERBOSE: Executing action. VERBOSE: Action has been executed. True PS C:\> $stream.Read()
[sudo] password for admin: ens192: flags=4163<UP,BROADCAST,RUNNING,MULTICAST> mtu 1500 inet 192.168.1.180 netmask 255.255.240.0 broadcast 192.168.15.255 inet6 fe80::20c:29ff:feeb:34a0 prefixlen 64 scopeid 0x20<link> ether 00:0c:29:eb:34:a0 txqueuelen 1000 (Ethernet) RX packets 300644 bytes 175076049 (166.9 MiB) RX errors 0 dropped 0 overruns 0 frame 0 TX packets 139657 bytes 56363667 (53.7 MiB) TX errors 0 dropped 0 overruns 0 carrier 0 collisions 0
lo: flags=73<UP,LOOPBACK,RUNNING> mtu 65536 inet 127.0.0.1 netmask 255.0.0.0 inet6 ::1 prefixlen 128 scopeid 0x10<host> loop txqueuelen 0 (Local Loopback) RX packets 0 bytes 0 (0.0 B) RX errors 0 dropped 0 overruns 0 frame 0 TX packets 0 bytes 0 (0.0 B) TX errors 0 dropped 0 overruns 0 carrier 0 collisions 0
[admin@localhost ~]$

maml:description.maml:para: Create Directory on Remote Server via SFTP
Create Directory on Remote Server via SFTP specified by Index or SFTP Session Object.
Exiting SFTP Session object.
Exiting SFTP Session object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para:
Create a folder in the /tmp directory on servia via a SFTP Session
C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code:
New-SFTPDirectory -SessionId 0 -Path "/tmp/tempfolder"
FullName : /tmp/tempfolder LastAccessTime : 3/16/2015 11:14:20 AM LastWriteTime : 3/16/2015 11:14:20 AM Length : 6 UserId : 1000

Creates a SSH shell stream for a given SSH Session.

Name of the terminal.
The columns
The rows.
The width.
The height.
Size of the buffer.

The columns
The rows.

The height.

The columns

The height.

SSH Session Object for an existing session.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para: C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code: $SSHStream = New-SSHShellStream -Index 0 PS C:\> $SSHStream.WriteLine("uname -a") PS C:\> $SSHStream.read() Last login: Sat Mar 14 20:02:16 2015 from infidel01.darkoperator.com [admin@localhost ~]$ uname -a Linux localhost.localdomain 3.10.0-123.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Jun 30 12:09:22 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux [admin@localhost ~]$

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new SSH Host and Fingerprint pait to the list of trusted SSH Hosts.
Adds a new SSH Host and Fingerprint pait to the list of trusted SSH Hosts.
IP Address of FQDN of host to add to trusted list.
SSH Server Fingerprint.
IP Address of FQDN of host to add to trusted list.
SSH Server Fingerprint.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:introduction.maml:para: C:\PS>

command:example.dev:code: New-SSHTrustedHost -SSHHost 192.168.10.20 -FingerPrint a4:6e:80:33:3f:31:4:cb:be:e9:a0:80:fb:38:fd:3b -Verbose VERBOSE: Adding to trusted SSH Host list 192.168.10.20 with a fingerprint of a4:6e:80:33:3f:31:4:cb:be:e9:a0:80:fb:38:fd:3b VERBOSE: SSH Host has been added.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a given SSH Host from the list of trusted hosts.

Change a SFTP Session current folder

PS C:\> Get-SFTPCurrentDirectory -SessionId 0 /tmp

Test if a file myfile-1.0.0.ipa exists in the /apps directory on server via a SFTP Session
